title: Update frontend contact phone and WhatsApp links to new number

requirements.summary: Replace phone number 9888377403 with 9888955099 across all frontend contact text, tel: links, and WhatsApp (wa.me) links while preserving consistent +91 / 91 formatting.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/constants/contact.ts` is updated so that: `CONTACT.phone.display` becomes "+91 9888955099", `CONTACT.phone.number` becomes "919888955099", and `CONTACT.phone.tel` becomes "tel:+919888955099".

`frontend/src/constants/contact.ts` is updated so that: `CONTACT.whatsapp.url` becomes "https://wa.me/919888955099" and `CONTACT.whatsapp.urlWithMessage` becomes "https://wa.me/919888955099?text=Hi,%20I%20have%20a%20query%20about%20your%20services!" (same prefilled message as before).
The floating WhatsApp button uses the updated WhatsApp URL with message (via `CONTACT.whatsapp.urlWithMessage`) and opens the chat to the new number.
A repo-wide check confirms there are no remaining occurrences of "9888377403" or "919888377403" in frontend source files or user-facing links.

file_operations.description: Update the CONTACT phone and WhatsApp constants to use the new number (display: "+91 9888955099"; number: "919888955099"; tel: "tel:+919888955099"; whatsapp.url: "https://wa.me/919888955099"; whatsapp.urlWithMessage: "https://wa.me/919888955099?text=Hi,%20I%20have%20a%20query%20about%20your%20services!"). This will propagate to all usages (e.g., Footer contact links and WhatsAppButton).
Add a small Node.js script that scans frontend source files for the old phone strings ("9888377403" and "919888377403") to support the required repo-wide check without changing app behavior.
